name: beta-Alanine
desc: β-Alanine (or beta-alanine) is a naturally occurring beta amino acid, which is an amino acid in which the amino group is at the β-position from the carboxylate group (i.e., two atoms away, see Figure 1). The IUPAC name for β-alanine is 3-aminopropanoic acid. Unlike its counterpart α-alanine, β-alanine has no stereocenter.

images.alt: Ball-and-stick model of the β-alanine molecule as a zwitterion

Solubility: soluble in methanol. Insoluble in diethyl ether, acetone
standard state:
